From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Asturian

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

atropellar (first-person singular indicative present atropello, past participle atropelláu)

  1. (intransitive) to run over (to drive over, causing injury or death)

Conjugation

[edit]

gerund atropellando

Derived terms

[edit]
  • atropellamientu

Further reading

[edit]
  • “atropellar”, in Diccionariu de la llingua asturiana [Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Asturian), 1ª edición, Academia de la Llingua Asturiana, 2000, →ISBN
  • Xosé Lluis García Arias (2002–2004), “atropellar”, in Diccionario general de la lengua asturiana [General Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Spanish), Editorial Prensa Asturiana, →ISBN

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From a- +‎ tropell +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [ə.tɾu.pəˈʎa]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [ə.tɾo.pəˈʎa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [a.tɾo.peˈʎaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

atropellar (first-person singular present atropello, first-person singular preterite atropellí, past participle atropellat); root stress: (Central, Valencia, Balearic) /e/

  1. to run over
  2. to rush

Conjugation

[edit]

gerund atropellant

Derived terms

[edit]
  • atropellament

Further reading

[edit]
  • “atropellar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From a- +‎ tropel +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • IPA(key): /atɾopeˈʝaɾ/ [a.t̪ɾo.peˈʝaɾ]
  • IPA(key): /atɾopeˈʝaɾ/ [a.t̪ɾo.peˈʝaɾ] (most of Spain and Latin America)
  • IPA(key): /atɾopeˈʎaɾ/ [a.t̪ɾo.peˈʎaɾ] (rural northern Spain, Andes Mountains, Paraguay, Philippines)
  • IPA(key): /atɾopeˈʃaɾ/ [a.t̪ɾo.peˈʃaɾ] (Buenos Aires and environs)
  • IPA(key): /atɾopeˈʒaɾ/ [a.t̪ɾo.peˈʒaɾ] (elsewhere in Argentina and Uruguay)

  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: a‧tro‧pe‧llar

Verb

[edit]

atropellar (first-person singular present atropello, first-person singular preterite atropellé, past participle atropellado)

  1. (transitive) to run over; to drive over
    Synonym: arrollar
  2. (transitive) to be abusive, to bully

Conjugation

[edit]

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
